Class Hoverball

java.lang.Object
GraphicObject
Toy
Hoverball
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable, MouseListener, Movable
public class Hoverball extends Toy
This class models a Hoverball, which inherits from Toy. Properties of the car include the x and y position of the ball

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class GraphicObject

    image, toySaga, x, y

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Hoverball(int x, int y)
    Constructs a new Hoverball whose image filename is ToySaga.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    draw()
    This method first sets the image of this Hoverball to ToySaga.
    void
    move()
    If the toySaga mode is night mode, this method bounces this Hoverball vertically by moving it with dx equals to zero and dy equals to a factor of 6 * PApplet.sin(toySaga.frameCount * 0.1f) use Math.round to cast the float to an int If the toySaga mode is day mode, this method moves this Hoverball as an ordinary Toy by calling the move() method defined in its super class.

    Methods inherited from class Toy

    isDragging, isMouseOver, isOver, move, onClick, onRelease, startDragging, stopDragging

    Methods inherited from class GraphicObject

    getX, getY, setImage, setProcessing

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Hoverball

      public Hoverball(int x, int y)
      Constructs a new Hoverball whose image filename is ToySaga. HOVERBALL_OFF located at the specified (x, y) position within the display window

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw()
      This method first sets the image of this Hoverball to ToySaga. HOVERBALL_ON if the toySaga mode is NIGHT_MODE and to ToSaga. HOVERBALL_OFF, otherwise.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface Drawable
      Overrides:
      draw in class Toy

    • move

      public void move()
      If the toySaga mode is night mode, this method bounces this Hoverball vertically by moving it with dx equals to zero and dy equals to a factor of 6 * PApplet.sin(toySaga.frameCount * 0.1f) use Math.round to cast the float to an int If the toySaga mode is day mode, this method moves this Hoverball as an ordinary Toy by calling the move() method defined in its super class.
      Specified by:
      move in interface Movable
      Overrides:
      move in class Toy
